description:
At revno 592, DB initialization is failed with new command 'db sync' of nova-manage as follows:

$ bin/nova-manage db sync
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 672, in <module>
    main()
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 664, in main
    fn(*argv)
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 543, in sync
    return migration.db_sync(version)
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/migration.py", line 33, in db_sync
    return IMPL.db_sync(version=version)
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 31, in db_sync
    db_version()
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 39, in db_version
    return versioning_api.db_version(FLAGS.sql_connection, repo_path)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 202, in db_version
    schema = ControlledSchema(engine, repository)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 24, in __init__
    self._load()
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 36, in _load
    self.table = Table(tname, self.meta, autoload=True)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/schema.py", line 209, in __new__
    table._init(name, metadata, *args, **kw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/schema.py", line 265, in _init
    reflecttable(self, include_columns=include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1866, in reflecttable
    self.dialect.reflecttable(conn, table, include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 228, in reflecttable
    return insp.reflecttable(table, include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/reflection.py", line 411, in reflecttable
    raise exc.NoSuchTableError(table.name)
sqlalchemy.exc.NoSuchTableError: migrate_version


It seems that an exception cannot be handled as expected at db_version() line 39 in nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py.

Regards,
Hisaki Ohara
title: DB tables cannot be created with nova-manage

comments.content:
At revno 592, DB initialization is failed with new command 'db sync' of nova-manage as follows:

$ bin/nova-manage db sync
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 672, in <module>
    main()
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 664, in main
    fn(*argv)
  File "bin/nova-manage", line 543, in sync
    return migration.db_sync(version)
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/migration.py", line 33, in db_sync
    return IMPL.db_sync(version=version)
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 31, in db_sync
    db_version()
  File "/home/ohara/Projects/OpenStack/nova/trunk/nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py", line 39, in db_version
    return versioning_api.db_version(FLAGS.sql_connection, repo_path)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/api.py", line 202, in db_version
    schema = ControlledSchema(engine, repository)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 24, in __init__
    self._load()
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/migrate/versioning/schema.py", line 36, in _load
    self.table = Table(tname, self.meta, autoload=True)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/schema.py", line 209, in __new__
    table._init(name, metadata, *args, **kw)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/schema.py", line 265, in _init
    reflecttable(self, include_columns=include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/base.py", line 1866, in reflecttable
    self.dialect.reflecttable(conn, table, include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/default.py", line 228, in reflecttable
    return insp.reflecttable(table, include_columns)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.6/dist-packages/SQLAlchemy-0.6.4-py2.6.egg/sqlalchemy/engine/reflection.py", line 411, in reflecttable
    raise exc.NoSuchTableError(table.name)
sqlalchemy.exc.NoSuchTableError: migrate_version


It seems that an exception cannot be handled as expected at db_version() line 39 in nova/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py.

Regards,
Hisaki Ohara
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hisaki

comments.content: Which version of python-migrate do you have installed?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content:
You'll need to run that command as root or the nova user.
"sudo nova-manage db sync" should work.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: python-migrate 0.5.4-3, which comes from the repository of Ubuntu 10.04.1 server.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hisaki

comments.content:
Thanks for giving me a hint, Soren.
When I made manual install of sqlalchemy-migrate 0.6, I could create DB.
I'll need to consider to change my environment to Ubuntu 10.10 based some time..
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hisaki

comments.content: I need to put a fresher migrate in the Lucid PPA. It's supposed to be a sort of supported platform.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren

comments.content:
Heheh :)

Apparently, I already did that yesterday.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~soren
